NewWords.WordPhrase: going or ready to go in the direction of 驶往；去
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. This ship is bound for Tokyo.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. start, engage in (a war, campaign, etc.) 发动
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The government is waging a campaign against sex discrimination in industry.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. people working on a ship, plane, etc. 全体（机组）人员，全体船员
v. go looking for (sth.) 侦察，搜索，寻找 n. 侦察员，侦察机
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. We'd better start scouting for a new secretary.

NewWords.WordPhrase: give a piece of secret information or a warning to (sb.) 向…密报，事先警告
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Someone tipped off the police about the robbery.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. seize (sb.) with the authority of the law 逮捕，拘留   n.
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He was arrested when customs officers found drugs in his bag.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. 联邦（制）的，（美国）联邦政府的  n. (F-) （美国）联邦调查局成员
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The Trans-Canada highway is a federal responsibility.

NewWords.WordPhrase: place special meaning or importance on (sth.) 强调
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Some schools put great emphasis on language study.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. (underwent undergone) experience or endure 经历，遭受，忍受
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The ship successfully underwent sea trials in coastal waters.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. persuade, attract 诱惑，吸引
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He was tempted into a life of crime by greed and laziness.

NewWords.WordPhrase: v. reserve (a room, seat, table etc.) 预订，登记
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Book early if you want to be sure of a seat.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 司法，审判；正义，正当，公平
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He demanded, with some justice, that he should be given an opportunity to express his views.

NewWords.WordPhrase: cause (sth.) to arise 引起，造成  vi. （拍照时）摆好姿势
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Winter poses particular difficulties for the elderly.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. respond to ...with an opposite view 反驳，反击  n. 柜台；计数器，筹码
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. They countered our proposal with one of their own.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 政府首脑会议，峰会；顶点，顶峰
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The president is currently attending a summit in Washington.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt., n. 屠杀，残杀；屠宰
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The playwright was slaughtered by the press.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 主人，东道主  vt. （作为主人）招待
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. We thanked our hosts for the lovely evening.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 新兵，新成员  v. 招募，招聘
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The police are trying to recruit more black and Asian officers.
